wikitext.*:
The term '''Men of Good Will''' was used by [[Elves]] during the [[Second Age]] to refer to non-[[Númenóreans|Númenórean]] [[Men]] in [[Middle-earth]] who were descended from those who opposed [[Morgoth]] during the [[First Age]].<ref name="will">{{NM|Delay}}</ref> The Men of Good Will consisted of tribes "who lived in [[Eriador]] and [[Calenardhon]] and the [[Vales of Anduin]] and in the [[Great wood|Great Wood]] and the plains between that and [[Mordor]] and the [[Sea of Rhûn]]."<ref name="will" /> These tribes included descendants of the [[Edain]] who remained in Middle-earth during the Second Age and dwelled in Eriador instead of sailing to [[Númenor]]; descendants of the Edain's close kin who had never travelled westward beyond the [[Blue Mountains]] into [[Beleriand]] during the First Age; "and others of remoter kin".<ref name="will" />
